Html:
I have used GMap.Net before in a Forms app and now wish to use it in a new WPF app.

I've got the map displayed and can drag it about using the mouse or touch screen, however a pinch type gesture on the multi-touch screen will not zoom. This works fine in my Forms application, do I need to do anything extra to enable this in WPF? If so what?

James
As I've had no replies I assume that no one else has tried to use the WPF control with a multi-touch screen before.
I only now see this thread. We are also trying to get this working. Did you had any success with it?

I could not find a way to get it working, so I had to use the Forms version of GMap. This has some issues in that Visual Studio and Blend will not render the window if the control is used, so I have to keep commenting it out every time I need to make other changes to the Window the control is embedded in.

If you do a google search you will be able to find how to use a forms control in a WPF Window.
I think I solved the problem
